item.title: Skill capes!
item.dc:creator: @jads jads
item.description:
@jads wrote:

Way to help out…

Okay, i’ll give you a mini-tut not much You have to figure out the rest it is only the “help” section,

Okay,

Add this void:

public void capeEmote() {

Then directly below that paste:(note: im only giving you attack skill cape Trimmed and untrimmed)

if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14073) { //attack stillgfx(346, absY, absX); stillgfx(427, absY, absX); stillgfx(83, absY, absX); setAnimation(2890); txt4 = "An attack skill cape."; playerLevel[0] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]); playerLevel[0] += 1; sendFrame126(""+playerLevel[0]+"", 4016); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; string4UpdateRequired = true; } if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14074) { //attack stillgfx(346, absY, absX); stillgfx(427, absY, absX); stillgfx(83, absY, absX); setAnimation(2890); txt4 = "An attack skill cape."; playerLevel[0] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]); playerLevel[0] += 1; sendFrame126(""+playerLevel[0]+"", 4016); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; string4UpdateRequired = true; }
Theres your attack cape,

For the rest change the skillcape id’s and gfx’s, and what it says

And there ya go.

Read full topic
